column4: rommer; there are a lot more advanced methods too that might work out better for you
rommer; as long as you use a single database and the webservers themselves are stateless, you're fine
rommer; things like phpbb, for example, are fine
rommer; you can make multiple copies of static content and scripts
rommer; but you need a single database
rommer; or multiple database servers with replication
dam_; on linux, you have to mark a program as 'executable' (+x) before you can run it....
dam_; it's sort of like the equivilent of a file being .exe on windows
pdg; what sort of card do you have?
I was having some other kind of troubles with a NVidia, so I changed the video card, and now there's something else
do you have any clue what that conflicting module could be?
(EE) fglrx(0): incompatible kernel module detected - HW accelerated OpenGL will not work
intel_agp is in use, and agpgart is needed by it
